definition: simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
always/ever/often/frequently/common/general/constant
surname Chang
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
see 便宜|便宜[pian2 yi5]
cooked rice/CL:碗[wan3]/meal/CL:頓|顿[dun4]/(loanword) fan/devotee

sentences.english: Over-night fame has become a common phenomenon in our modern society.
sentences.chinese: 一夜成名成了現代社會的家常便飯。

sentences.english: Peter, you should have told them it’s only a little supper.
sentences.chinese: 彼得，你應該告訴他們這只是一頓家常便飯。

sentences.english: We have the old system during rewrite, so chaos is constant.
sentences.chinese: 我們重寫舊的系統，因此混亂是家常便飯。

sentences.english: Nowadays you have a game Saturday, Tuesday, Saturday, Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 現在一週雙賽是家常便飯。

sentences.english: We've had a lot of coups in my country too.
sentences.chinese: 在我的國家裏政變也是家常便飯。

sentences.english: The pre-race inquiries have become as routine as the postrace drug screens.
sentences.chinese: 賽前質詢已經像賽後藥檢一樣是家常便飯了。

sentences.english: Put on the table, it is a common practice in the ordinary vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 擺在飯桌上，則是家常便飯中的普通菜。

sentences.english: Of course disciplining our children is a given in any home.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，教導孩子在任何家庭中都是家常便飯了。

sentences.english: Yet Miss Politkovskaya was often threatened with death.
sentences.chinese: 然而，死亡威脅對安娜而言是家常便飯。

sentences.english: Being stopped by militsiya was a regular occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 被警察攔住問話是家常便飯。

sentences.english: In the streets of Athens, demonstrations have become everyday occurrences.
sentences.chinese: 在雅典街頭，遊行示威已成爲家常便飯。

sentences.english: In India, recriminations after the Mumbai attacks have been rife.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，孟買襲擊以後的互相指責成了家常便飯。

sentences.english: So having scorched thighs is becoming commonplace amongst the techie set.
sentences.chinese: 待在這些零件附近，大腿燙得像焦了一般是家常便飯。

definition: lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
a common occurrence (idiom)
accustomed to/used to
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
hard to understand/incomprehensible
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
easy/with no difficulty
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
careless/reckless/casually/absent-mindedly/at will/at random/any old how
fortunately/luckily
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
unwilling
